intro: Richardella dulcifica, commonly known as the sweetroot or bitterroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are the primary botanical feature, containing compounds that have been historically used in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
